firstch.description: The flash transition at the beginning of the film was originally meant to start the film outside the Harvard Depository in the cold and dark rather than inside in the vault's own cold and dark corridors.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8fFcXE1lYQg?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: One original idea in Cold Storage was to evoke film production equipment as Alain Resnais did to illustrate our technological extensions of memory.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/71UiB5mQdcQ?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: In addition to a Blackmagic Cinema Camera, Cold Storage also employed a Canon T2i DSLR and a GoPro Hero 3+, both pictured here. The GoPro's size made it adaptable to various riggings like the makeshift one we invented here to capture the forest canopy from below.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.flickr.com/photos/116285016@N05/16190331907/player/" width=“492" height=“277" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: A early glimpse at how the long aisle tracking shots were acheived. For shots without swerve, we later improved on this method with half of the dolly on the rubber wheels and half on skateboard wheels that could slide along the structural ridges already on the edge of each aisle.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="369" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E4IuaTj1T7Q?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: Marshall Ford maps the facility by pushing a book cart mounted with a camera angled 90 degrees at the ceiling. Marshall was a student of Humanities Studio I, also entitled Cold Storage, which generated final projects surrounding the Harvard Depository and was taught by the metaLAB team in Spring of 2014.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ffVweB3h3xc?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: Peter Kirschman presents a brief history of the Harvard Depository and its choice mode of internal item transit, the Raymond order picker.

firstch.description: Peter Kirschman doffs his shoes to avoid squeaking on the floor while recording audio.

firstch.description: A shoeless Peter Kirschman pursues the sounds of an operating order picker.

firstch.description: A "slow TV" walkthrough of Keith Lyseth's daily routine from a chest-mounted camera. Features cameos by Marshall Ford and Peter Kirschman, working on their student films, as well as Jeffrey Schnapp recording ambient sounds of the Harvard Depository.

firstch.description:
Toute la mémoire du monde (All the World's Memory) is a 1956 film set around the organization of the Bibliothèque nationale de France (French National Library). Directed by Alain Resnais. Cinematography by Ghislain Cloquet. Written by Rémo Forlani. 
Narration by Jacques Dumesnil. Score by Maurice Jarre. Music conducted by Georges Delerue.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/i0RVSZ_yDjs?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: This aerial shot of the Bibliothèque nationale de France (French National Library) was grafted onto the front of the Raymond order picker at the beginning of Cold Storage.

firstch.description: "In addition to books, the Depository’s also used to house certain university records and archives, microform, and other media. Each unit is 36 feet high by 45 feet wide by 192 feet long…"

firstch.description: “Fire separation walls were constructed between each module and the adjacent office and work areas have comprehensive detection systems and sprinklers."

firstch.description: An elevation diagram illustrating the aisles of Module 7A & 7B. It features the location of the film vault, which is kept at even colder temperatures as well as the location of the mezzanine, which is home to machinery for the Depository's climate regulation and air filtration systems.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.flickr.com/photos/116285016@N05/16367672255/player/" width=“492" height=“380" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: From the Raymond Corporation's YouTube Channel: "http://www.raymondcorp.com/OrderPickers A Powerful choice of Order Pickers in 24 and 36 volts and heights up to 390". Order Pickers featuring our exclusive ACR System™ deliver faster, smoother operation with less downtime and reduced cost of ownership. All of these trucks feature variable lift and lower, simultaneous function control handles, power steering with auto-steer centering to improve load handling to increase productivity. Pick from a full array of configurations and options to exceed your needs."

firstch.description: General Population n. (1) In prison organization, the group of inmates who are not given any specific treatment such as solitary confinement, protective custody, or suicide watch. (2) In epidemiology, all individuals without reference to any specific characteristic. (3) At the Harvard Depository, what the staff calls the collective shelved content in cold storage.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.flickr.com/photos/116285016@N05/16387991232/player/" width="492" height="492" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe>

firstch.description: Raymond n. (1) The brand of order picker used at the Harvard Depository for retrieving library contents from trays stored higher than human reach. (2) A common nickname used for the mechanical lifts by workers at the Harvard Depository.
firstch.location: <iframe width="492" height="277" src="https://www.flickr.com/photos/116285016@N05/15768901703/in/photostream/player/" width="492" height="492" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe>
